intro: Hieracium concolorans, commonly known as the common hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, preferring sunny to partially shaded environments. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow with ray florets. Hieracium concolorans is known for its ability to spread through rhizomes and is sometimes considered a weed in agricultural settings.
